column4: I am trying to install Ubuntu on my new Acer Aspire 3000 Series laptop. It boots from the disc, and loads the first screen, but when I try to install, it loads the kernel, then just sits there, with a blank screen.
did you set the screen resolution?  some laptops need you to do that
it should show up at the bottom of the screen, press F4 or something
np's :) you may need to add noapic and nolapic if it's a on older laptop
should be okay then - if the desktop seems to lag a bit, try adding that, some laptop mobos are a bit special
